reviewText: I don't know why companies can't release a complete series at a good price.Seasons 1&2 have been released from classic media.Where are seasons three, four, and five.I hope the complete series set will be reduced in price.The new movie will be in theatres on July 3, 2013.PLEASE RELEASE THE LONE RANGER SEASONS 3, 4, 5 BEFORE THE END OF TIME.
Title: Lone Ranger: 28 Thrilling Episodes

reviewText: "The Lone Ranger" is a milestone in television history. Unfortunately, it appears the various releases by Genius Entertainment/Classic Media are the best we are going to get (these companies have issued this release, a seasons one and two release, and a complete series release). This particular release is part of the seasons one and two release, providing the buyer with discs 2, 4, 6 and 7 from that set (yet labeled discs 1-4). The labeling on the menu screen, however, coincides with the discs in the larger set.That said, I am really glad that I just purchased this smaller set, as the quality is quite below par, and I would hate to have splurged and spent more money for low quality material. (Especially the $129 going rate for the complete series!)Picture quality is above average, though film damage still pops up from time to time. My problem is with the way this set was assembled, and the source material.The times for the episodes vary from ~25 to ~22 minutes, so some complete episodes appear. (The complete episodes are quite acceptable, even including the lead-ins to commercial breaks.) The majority of episodes, however, are edited, and not in a professional manner, either. Jump cuts are prevalent. Abrupt scene changes are prevalent. And time compression in certain scenes is obvious. (The fight scene in the episode "High Heels" is sped up to a rate equal to that of old Keystone Kops movies. If it weren't for the fact that I'd paid good money for this set, it would almost be funny!)Opening credits are obviously not the original, as their is an inserted head/torso shot of the Lone Ranger right before Silver bucks. It looks quite out of place.Beyond the episodes themselves, the manner in which they are assembled on the DVD is also quite poor. The episodes are all linked together, such that they are merely chapters within one long "movie". Unless your DVD player is equipped with a timer for each chapter, you will not be able to tell the time lapsed in any given episode, except for the first on each disc. This also means that even if you select a given episode from the menu, when that episode ends, the next episode will begin, instead of returning you to the menu screen.As I said before, I am really glad I didn't spend much on this set, and especially glad I didn't purchase one of the large sets. Edited episodes (and worse than that, compressed scenes) make this a really poor tribute to the masked man. Sadly, it's all we'll probably ever see.
summary: Sadly, this is probably the best we're going to get
Title: Lone Ranger: 28 Thrilling Episodes

reviewText: If you are curious, this is simply discs 2,4,6 and 7 from the previously released box set and all from season one.  This is a terrific sampling from the first season and a great and inexpensive way to sample the beginning of the legend. Of course it would  have been better if they included disc 1 with the actual beginning of the Lone Ranger story. A MUCH better deal (now around $20) is this setThe Lone Ranger: 75th Anniversary - Seasons 1 and 2for about twice the investment you get 78 episodes instead of only 28 and all kinds of wonderful extras. I imagine most true lone ranger fans will not even check out this product but I thought I'd tell those curious just what it is.
summary: a good value for sure but there is much better....
Title: Lone Ranger: 28 Thrilling Episodes

reviewText: Although he isn't as popular as he once was, The Lone Ranger remains an icon of American pop culture. Unfortunately, he is an icon that many younger people are only vaguely aware. I was lucky growing up because my parents exposed my siblings and I to all of the tv Westerns and pop culture of their youth, including THE LONE RANGER.If you are curious about The Lone Ranger, THE LONE RANGER: 28 THRILLING EPISODES DVD is an ok place to start. The set contains four discs that include 28 episodes from Seasons 1 & 2 of THE LONE RANGER tv show. If you've never seen the tv show, this set gives you an idea about what it was like.Unfortunately, there are a few flaws with this set. For example, although the film quality is excellent, the editing for many episodes is not done in a very good manner (many sudden scene changes, jump cuts, faster ratios for some scenes, etc.). Also, the opening credits are not the original opening credits. I was disappointed by this because, for the most part, I like watching older television shows with their original openings and closings. Finally, as a set of discs that can introduce people to The Lone Ranger, it's disappointing that this set doesn't contain the episode that actually introduces the origins of the character.THE LONG RANGER: 28 THRILLING EPISODES is a decent DVD collection of some of the first and second season episodes of THE LONG RANGER tv show. For 28 episodes of classic television, it's incredibly inexpensively priced. However, if you're more of a completist, like myself then you will probably be better off with either THE LONE RANGER - 75TH ANNIVERSARY or THE LONE RANGER: COLLECTORS EDITION.
summary: A Decent Introduction (But Without the Origins)
Title: Lone Ranger: 28 Thrilling Episodes

reviewText: This was a great addition to my "Lone Ranger" collection. I now have a total of 61 different episodes, and the two feature length movies, of the "Masked Man". But I know that there should be many more available as the series lasted for 5 or 6 years. I wish someone would release the complete series on DVD like they did with the old Richard Greene  "Adventures of Robin Hood" several years ago. Really enjoyed watching them.
Title: Lone Ranger: 28 Thrilling Episodes
